result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica D Spoto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Monica D Spoto in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Dave T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possess Drug Paraphernalia, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.573(1), an unclassified Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve TWENTY (20) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for TWENTY (20) DAYS served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 10-22-2018 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Monica D Spoto in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Monica D Spoto in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Drug Court Treatment Contract, received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
